p: The existence of antimicrobial resistance of several pathogenic organisms is one of the issues that has continued to be of concern to scientists and the abuse of antimicrobial drugs is one factor that has contributed to this problem ( Ekhaise et al., 2012). Scientists have sustained the search for new and effective medicines targeted against various microbial strains. Plant materials continue to be the preferred starting material for discovery of potential antimicrobial drugs ( Akinsulire et al., 2007; Ekhaise et al., 2012) due to the presence of compounds such as phenolics, tannins, and essential oils synthesized in the secondary metabolism of medicinal plants ( Nascimento et al., 2000).
